div.p: The WSO2 Message Broker team is pleased to announce the 3.0.0 RC2 release of WSO2 Message Broker (MB).

WSO2 Message Broker (WSO2 MB) v 3.0.0 is fast, lightweight and user friendly open source distributed message brokering system under the Apache Software License v2.0. WSO2 MB allows system administrators and developers to easily configure jms queues and topics which could be used in message routing, message stores, message processors. It also supports transport ws eventing. WSO2 MB is compliant with Advanced Message Queueing Protocol Version 0-91 and Java Message Service Specification version 1.1.

WSO2 MB v 3.0.0 is developed on top of the revolutionary WSO2 Carbon platform (Middleware a' la carte), an OSGi based framework that provides seamless modularity to your SOA via componentization. This release also contains many new features and a range of optional components (add-ons) that can be installed to customize the behavior of the MB. Further, any existing features of the MB which are not required to your environment can be easily removed using the underlying provisioning framework of Carbon. In brief, WSO2 MB can be fully customized and tailored to meet your exact SOA needs.

You can download this distribution from
http://wso2.org/downloads/message-broker

ol.li: Go to the bin directory in the extracted folder
Run the wso2server.sh or wso2server.bat as appropriate
Point your browser to the URL https://localhost:9443/carbon
Use "admin", "admin" as the username and password to login as an admin

If you need to start the OSGi console with the server use the property -DosgiConsole when starting the server. The INSTALL.txt file found on the installation directory will give you a comprehensive set of options and properties that can be passed into the startup script

div.p: This release of Message Broker comes with a horde of new features and bug fixes.
MB-614 Dead Letter Channel Support
MB-615 Message Flow Controlling Support
MB-120 Message Selector support
MB-616 Queue permission controlling support
MB-479 Carbon profiles for Cassandra
MB-479 Carbon profiles for Zookeeper
MB-617 Queue Subscription Details
MB-618 Topic Subscription Details
div.h2: Key Features of WSO2 Message Broker
div.p: WSO2 Message Broker brings messaging and eventing capabilities into your SOA framework. Message Broker contains all the previously available features except SQS support. Those are :

ul.li: Queue Message browsing with added UI support
Message Re delivery Header Field support
Sample text message sender tool in UI
Viewing details of the cluster using Management Console
Cassandra replication factor and read/write consistency levels configurations

div.p: The underlying JMS engine handles WS-Eventing/JMS synchronisation that enables exposing and consuming your events using two different standard API's.
